'''Logan''' is one of [[Lexie Grey|Lexie's]]\uainterns at\ua[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].



On his first day of internship, he was given the usual intern speech by his resident, Lexie Grey. He was the intern to ask if they were going into an OR today.

Later that day, one of Logan's patient started crashing. He started panicking but luckily Meredith was around to help. She asked for the patient's rhythm and made him check for a pulse and listen to the patient's breath sounds. He doubtfully said the right one sounded less. Not knowing that Meredith was actually fired, he let her take over the care over his patient until Bailey walked by and noticed what Meredith was doing. She took over care and she and Meredith instructed Logan to grab the biggest needle he could find.\ua''("[[Free Falling]]")''


Logan was part of the group of interns who failed to do a physical exam on Ruth Bennet after she complained of stomach pain, missing that she had appendicitis. ''("[[Take the Lead]]")''


When [[Morgan Peterson|Morgan]] had a heart attack and her baby had to be delivered early so she could have heart surgery, Logan took over testing Alex for his boards. ''("[[Have You Seen Me Lately?]]")''


Logan is an intern at\ua[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]. He is part of Lexie Grey's class of five interns.


*Logan has two other male interns in his group and two female ones.

'''Louie''' came into the hospital after being impaled with a decorative jumbo candy cane.


Louie had an argument with his wife, so he left to blow off some steam. He realized after he slammed the door that the storm was serious, but he didn't want to lose the momentum of the slam, so he went for a walk. During his walk, the wind storm picked up, stirring up a large candy cane, which impaled him through his chest. He was taken to the hospital, where they diagnosed a pneumothorax, but no other obvious injuries. He was taken to surgery, where they cut the top off the candy cane and pulled it through. They were prepared for extensive bleeding and were shocked when they saw the candy cane had not caused any damage to his internal organs aside from a small hole in his diaphragm. His was was told he'd need to rest for a few weeks, but would be okay.



He is married to [[Veronica]]. Despite their fighting, she says they truly love each other and even when they fought, he would always come back to her.

'''Maddy Carlson''' came to the hospital because of a small facial laceration after shooting her father.


Maddy and her mother came into the ER after Maddy shot her father. Her mother had said that her father was using his gun, left it alone, and she got her hands on it and accidentally shot her father. As [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]] was examining her, Maddy's mother had said that the kickback had hit her in the face and that is how she got the cut, despite Arizona saying that's not what it looked like. When Arizona was paged, she handed Maddy off to [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]]. As Meredith was stitching her facial laceration, Maddy asked if her father was going to die. Meredith said she didn't know. Maddy asked how come she didn't know. Then said "I shot him a lot of times. Why he don't die?" It was later revealed she was trying to stop him because she and her mother were being abused by her father. After being yelled at by Meredith for not protecting her child and for keeping Maddy in the home, Maddy's mother decided to leave her husband. When her father was in ICU, her mother took her to say goodbye to her father because it was the last time she was going to see him.



Her father was abusive toward her and her mother, which resulted in Maddy taking a gun and shooting her father several times, trying to kill him. He survived his surgery, but Kate took Maddy and left, saying he wouldn't be in any condition to follow them anytime soon.


*She was six at the time of her hospitalization.

And now I'm here with you aliens. Except I'm the alien, and I'm all alone, and I have nothing, and no one wants me.|'''Maggie Pierce'''}} '''Maggie Pierce''' is the current [[Attending#Department Head|Co-Head]] of [[Cardiothoracic Surgery]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] alongside [[Teddy Altman]]. She is the biological child of [[Ellis Grey]] and [[Richard Webber]] and thus half-sister to [[Meredith Grey]]. She is married to [[Winston Ndugu]]. Maggie is very driven and finished both high school and medical school faster than normal. She worked extremely hard and was a focused student. She states that she graduated early from Yale, but it is unknown whether this was in reference to undergrad or medical school.\ua Maggie interviewed for the position of head of cardiothoracic surgery at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. She was hired soon after. Her flight to Seattle from Boston was one of the worst flying experiences ever. Due to some technical issue, the plane stayed on the tarmac and the passengers had to remain in their seats. It was very hot on the plane and they were not allowed to use the restroom or given any water. Eventually, after four hours, the flight was just cancelled with no apology whatsoever.[[One Flight Down]], x Two weeks after being hired, Maggie told [[Richard Webber|Dr. Richard Webber]] that she was adopted, and that years prior, she looked for her birth mom and needed to go to the court for the records. Pierce is the current [[Attending#Department Head|Co-Head]] of [[Cardiothoracic Surgery]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] with [[Teddy Altman]]. She finished high school, college, and [[Medical School|med school]] early. After med school, she began and subsequently completed a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Resident|residency]] at [[Tufts Medical Center]]. At twenty-five, she began her [[Fellow|cardiothoracic surgery fellowship]]. Some time after, she was promoted to head the cardiothoracic surgical department. Two years later, Pierce applied for the Head of Cardio position at Grey Sloan Memorial and succeeded [[Jeff Russell]] as the new department head. Despite having submitted her notice of resignation very early in her tenure for personal reasons, she was convinced to remain at her post by [[Derek Shepherd]]. She quit her job when losing [[Sabrina Webber]] caused her to lose faith in her own abilities, which she deemed necessary for her job. She was then made an offer by [[Richard Webber]] to come run the Cardio department at [[Pacific Northwest General Hospital]]. She accepted the offer but the hospital was purchased by the [[Catherine Fox Foundation]] and closed down on her first day. Like all other staff, she had to interview for a job at Grey Sloan with [[Tom Koracick]] and ended up hired as Co-Chief of Cardiothoracic Surgery, sharing the job with Teddy, who had been hired to replace Maggie after she quit. *Maggie finished high school and medical school early.[[Everything I Try to Do, Nothing Seems to Turn Out Right]], x *The writers stated they knew about Maggie's existence since the very beginning and wanted to introduce the character ever since season , but chose to introduce Thatcher's other children first; afterward, it never felt like the right time until Cristina left, creating a hole in Meredith's life. This also led Shonda to claim that there have been indirect references to Maggie over the course of the series. |name = Marian Davidson
|status = Alive

|only appearance = [[Grandma Got Run Over By a Reindeer]]
|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Michael Hyatt]]
}}
'''Marian Davidson''' is the mother of [[Justin Davidson]].



When Marian's son, Justin, was a baby, he received a heart transplant. The transplant went well and the graft kept him alive for ten more years.


Several years later, Justin's transplanted heart started failing, so he was put on the list to wait for a new one. When it became available around Christmas, his mother told him Santa brought him a new heart, but Justin flatly rejected it, saying he should give it to someone else. Despite his objections, he received the heart transplant. During the surgery, Burke asked Cristina to call for a psych consult, but she wasn't able to get one because psych was very busy because of the holidays. Burke said his mom needed to find someone for Justin to talk to.

Marian called in [[Father Michael]]. Before he arrived, Justin woke up from his surgery and said his mother had claimed that the last two Christmases could be his last.

Father Michael came and Justin said he knew that Santa wasn't real and there's no such thing as God and another kid had to die to give him his new heart. While talking to them, Justin coded. Cristina was able to get him back, but they said he needed to decide to live or he would die.

Cristina talked to Justin about her not believing in God or Santa. She believes in medicine, which she says is so much cooler than Santa. She said he should fight to live so that the can grow up and figure out a way to do heart transplants without someone having to die. Or grow up and have kids and raise them not to believe in Santa. She said dying wasn't the best revenge for him.

After speaking to Cristina, Justin's condition rapidly improved.



She has one son, Justin. She cared for him deeply, but he resented her lying to him about where his heart transplants came from.


*[[Cristina Yang|Cristina]] compared Marian to [[Helen Rubenstein|her own mother]].

{{DEFAULTSORT:Davidson, Marian}}

'''Marjorie Reed''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] with terminal lung cancer.


Marjorie had small-cell lung cancer with mets on her liver. Her condition was terminal. She coded one morning, but was able to be revived. However, she was in extreme pain. When her daughter, Jeannie, stepped out of the room, she talked to [[Maggie Pierce|Dr. Pierce]] and asked to be allowed to die. When she was offered the chance to sign DNR papers, she said her daughter would never allow it and her daughter had her power of attorney.

When she coded again later that day while her daughter was out getting dinner, Maggie did a slow code and allowed her to die.



She was married for  years until her husband died.


Her daughter, Jeannie, was with her in the hospital. She didn't want her mother to die and pushed her to stay alive even when she was in extreme pain. When she was told that her mother had died, she was devastated.


She, along with her husband, taught English in Japan for a while.


*She was  at the time of her death.
*She was pronounced dead at :.

'''Martha Elkin''' was a patient who needed a quadruple CABG.


Martha had been diagnosed with multi-vessel coronary disease for which she needed a CABG. She and her husband were both worried about her surgery.

Right before her surgery, she thought about backing out, but Cristina talked to her and reassured her that she'd be okay and if she didn't have the surgery, she and her family would always be worried about when she'd die. She agreed to have the surgery and it was successful.



She is married. Her husband wondered how long she'd be asleep after her surgery.


She has at least two children. She didn't want to be a burden to her family in case something went wrong in her surgery.


She has a friend named Donna who had a big surgery like hers and was never the same afterward. She was in a nursing home, unable even to feed herself.


*She was  at the time of her surgery.

'''Martin Carroll''' came into the ER after having a heart attack after seeing [[Kirby|a lion]] loose in [[Seattle]].


Martin and his wife, Emma, were in Seattle on their way to Alaska on a cruise for their anniversary. While they were walking around, the saw [[Kirby|a lion]]. Martin had a heart attack and had to be taken to the ER. From there, he was taken to angioplasty to open up the blockages.

In angioplasty, he had another heart attack. They placed a balloon pump, but he still needed a coronary artery bypass.

As they went to take Martin off bypass, there was a rupture. Despite this complication, Teddy was able to repair the damage and the surgery was successful.

However, when Teddy went out to the waiting room to inform Emma that he had made it, she found Emma dead. They attempted resuscitation in the ER, but it was unsuccessful and Teddy had to tell Martin that Emma had died.



He was married to [[Emma Carroll]] until her death.


Marin and Emma's children bought them a cruise to celebrate their th anniversary.

'''Michael Hall''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



As an infant, Michael received a heart transplant that saved his life.


As a teenager, the mitral valve in his heart failed. Rather than taking the simple choice and going back on the donor list, he and his parents decided to have [[Cristina Yang]] replace the valve. However, this surgery was unsuccessful and they were forced to put him back on the transplant list.



Michael lives with his parents, who are very supportive of him and his decision to attempt valve replacement instead of waiting for a second heart transplant.

'''Mike''' is the fianc\ue of [[Kelsey Simmons]].


Mike was on a date with [[Kelsey Simmons]], their fourth date, when he had to rush Kelsey to the hospital. She had a pseudoaneurysm along the suture line of her transplanted heart which made her heart useless. It had to be removed and she was put on a machine to keep her blood circulating. He stayed with her, even though he was supposed to be spending Thanksgiving with his family. Her condition continued to worsen and she had to have surgery under local anesthesia on Christmas day when part of her bowel died due to poor circulation. Because of the circumstance, they allowed Mike to come into the OR with her and they sang Christmas songs to keep her calm.

Finally, on New Years Day, Kelsey got a heart transplant. Mike pulled out a ring and proposed to her, saying they'd been through a war together and he wanted to spend the rest of his life with her. She accepted.



He had been on four dates with [[Kelsey Simmons]] when she was hospitalized. Despite the length of their relationship, he stayed by her bedside. After she received a heart transplant, he proposed to her, saying they'd been through a war together and he wanted to spend the rest of his life with her. She accepted.


He and Kelsey were supposed to spend Thanksgiving with his family, but instead, he stayed at the hospital with her.

'''Mike Carlson''' is a patient who came into the ER with multiple gunshot wounds.


According to his wife, he was using his gun and left it alone and his daughter got a hold of it and shot him multiple times. When he was brought into the ER, the doctors examined him and found two graze wounds, nine that went through, and five on the left side of his body.

During surgery, he started bleeding extensively so Owen sent Cristina to get a powder from his truck to suppress it. It bought them some time to repair his injuries. They ended up having to remove one of his lungs and one kidney. He survived the surgery and was awake and stable afterwards.



He is married to [[Kate Carlson]]. He was abusive toward her and their daughter. After he was hospitalized, she left him.


His daughter shot him to stop him from beating her and her mother.

'''Mindy Carlson''' is the wife of [[James Carlson]], the man who came into [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] with a bomb in his chest.



Mindy Carlson is the wife of James Carlson who came to the Seattle Hospital with a bazooka shell in his chest.\uaShe came into the ER with him screaming loudly. Alex eventually got her to stop crying and figured out that nothing was wrong with her and all the blood on her was her husband's. She was concerned about whether or not her husband would live, especially after hearing that the round in his chest was live and could explode at any moment. ''("[[It's the End of the World]]")''

With the help of [[Dylan Young]] of the Bomb Squad, they developed a plan to get the bomb out of his cavity and operate on his chest. After some complications, they did so and Mindy was told that James would be okay. ''("[[As We Know It]]")''



Mindy had a loving relationship with her husband, [[James Carlson]]. She felt that James\u WW obsession was childish, but was very upset when he became injured. She and James have three kids together.

'''Molly''' is the girlfriend of [[Todd Holmes]].


Molly came into the hospital with her boyfriend, Todd, who was having trouble breathing. She thought he was just having an anxiety attack because she asked him to move in with her, but it turned out that his heart had drifted and was compressing his lung. She felt guilty for her assumption. Todd was taken into surgery to place implants to move his heart back into place. After his surgery, she was told he'd be okay, but she wondered if he'd even want to see her because of the way she'd accused him of wanting other women before his surgery. Teddy told her that thinking you like a guy more than he likes you can make you a little crazy.



She is dating [[Todd Holmes]]. She asked him to move in with her, but he was reluctant because his parents got married really young and hated each other by the time he was born.

'''Mr. Al-Hasan''' is the father of [[Jarah Al-Hasan]].


Mr. Al-Hasan came to the hospital when he learned his son, Jarah, had been injured. Maggie told him Jarah had severe injuries to his chest and had also been using LSD, which shocked Mr. Al-Hasan. When Jarah started coughing blood, Maggie intubated him and had Mr. Al-Hasan escorted outside. She came to the waiting room to tell him his son needed surgery. While they were talking, [[River Epley|River's]] dad, [[Mr. Epley]], said Mr. Al-Hasan should be arrested because Jarah gave River drugs. Mr. Al-Hasan said that the kids were at Mr. Epley's house. As the fight escalated, Bailey broke things up and told them that parenting is hard, especially with teenagers. Parents need to work together to survive it and keep their kids alive. Mr. Al-Hasan was sitting by his son's bed after his surgery when River and his father came to apologize to him. He told River that he knew he didn't meant to hurt Jarah and he was glad River was okay.



He came to the hospital when he learned his son was injured.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Al-Hasan, Mr.}}

'''Mr. Duff''' is a psych patient who believed he was psychic.


Mr. Duff was admitted to the hospital by his family after he claimed to be psychic. He said he talks to dead people and his family thought he was dangerous. After he was admitted, he had two seizures, so he had to be cleared by surgery before he could be returned to psych. While they examined him, he had another seizure, but he claimed it was a vision. He said someone on the fourth floor would die. Immediately afterward, a code blue was called for the fourth floor.

They ran a scan which showed the seizures, so Cristina ordered an MRI to get a better look at his brain. When he predicted her pregnancy, Cristina asked to be moved off the case. Izzie took over. She ran a scan that showed an arteriovenous malformation in his temporal lobe.

Mr. Duff was told he needed surgery, but he declined consent, still convinced it was visions and not seizures. Izzie talked to him, saying that if he really did have a gift, he needed to believe that the gift would still be there after he had the surgery. He agreed to have the surgery. After surgery, he woke up and was still having his visions.



After he told them he talked to dead people, his family had him admitted to the psychiatric ward because they believed he was dangerous.


*He gave Izzie the missing ingredient from her cupcakes and called her Cricket, her mother's nickname for her.
*He figured out that Cristina was pregnant.
*He told [[Debbie]] to stay away from anesthesiologists. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")''

{{DEFAULTSORT:Duff, Mr.}}

'''Mr. Epley''' is the father of [[River Epley]].


Mr. Epley came to the hospital when he learned his son was injured. Teddy took him to his son's bed, but it was empty as River had gotten up and left. He struggled to get information from the doctors, which upset him. While [[Jarah Al-Hasan|Jarah's]] father, [[Mr. Al-Hasan]] was talking to the doctors, Mr. Epley said he should be arrested because Jarah gave River drugs. Mr. Al-Hasan said that the kids were at Mr. Epley's house. As the fight escalated, Bailey broke things up and told them that parenting is hard, especially with teenagers. Parents need to work together to survive it and keep their kids alive. When River worried that Jarah's father wouldn't let them be friends anymore, Mr. Epley said that Jarah's father loves him the way he loves River and they'd work it out. He took River to apologize to Jarah's father.



He was worried about his son when he was injured.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Epley, Mr.}}

'''Mr. Gaston''' is a patient who had a lung resection to treat his cancer.


Mr. Gaston had been diagnosed with non-small cell lung cancer. To treat the cancer, he needed a lung resection. They took him into surgery and in surgery, they discovered that he had a cardiac tear from the tumor invading, a "broken heart." Burke repaired the tear and Mr. Gaston was awake and stable afterward.


He owns a couple dry cleaning stores. He never believed what they said about inhaling the chemicals until he was diagnosed with cancer.

'''Mr. Johnson''' is the father of [[Bryce Johnson]].


After his baby was born at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]], the peds doctors detected a heart murmur which they believed was benign, but when Meredith thought differently, she told the baby's parents. As a result, [[Paul Kay|Dr. Kay]] allowed [[Preston Burke|Burke]] to take the baby on as his patient and get an echo.

After the echo, it was revealed that the baby had a birth defect and needed heart surgery. Burke then booked the OR for the following day.

'''Mr. Vanderburg''' impaled himself on a metal pole when he crashed his bike.


Mr. Vanderburg was riding his bike when he ran into a wrought iron fence, which penetrated his chest. He was taken to the emergency room where his heart was determined to be the size of of a football due to his injuries. [[Dr. McQueen]] and [[Alex Karev]] prepared to operate on him. However, before they could, [[Cristina Yang]] appealed to his wife, saying that [[Teddy Altman]] was an excellent surgeon, the best her husband could hope for, prompting her to demand that Teddy take his case. His surgery was successful, but Teddy stayed to monitor him overnight.



He is married to [[Mrs. Vanderburg]].

'''Mrs. Dickerson''' is the wife of [[Larry Shane Dickerson|Larry Dickerson]].


Mrs. Dickerson came into the ER with her husband, Larry, who had driven into the fish market. She claimed that it was like the car was possessed and he couldn't stop it. She was asked to asked to give a statement to the police, but she insisted on staying with her husband.

When Larry was diagnosed with spinal stenosis, Derek asked his wife about it, but she said that Larry was healthy before the accident, despite the fact that they believed he couldn't feel his feet at all with how advanced his condition was.

When she saw [[Janelle Duco]] being taken into surgery, she admitted that she knew her husband had trouble with his feet. Her daughter had taken his keys when she was in town, but she gave them back to him because Larry loved to drive. Bailey then took her to talk to the police and tell them what had happened.



She is married to [[Larry Shane Dickerson]].


She has a daughter who had taken away her husband's keys.


She is [[Janelle Duco|Janelle Duco's]] best customer.


*During filming, [[Patrick Dempsey]] kept mispronouncing her name as "Dickinson".

{{DEFAULTSORT:Dickerson, Mrs.}}

'''Mrs. Harper''' is the wife of [[Jimmy Harper]].


Mrs. Harper's husband, Jimmy, collapsed while making waffles and was rushed to the hospital, where he had coronary bypass surgery. The day after his surgery, he had no output from his chest tube, so they checked for occlusion. They found one and relieved it, so the fluid build-up was released.

He later became unstable due to a clot, which forced Izzie to open his incision bedside to remove the clot. She then massaged his heart until he stabilized.



She is married to [[Jimmy Harper]].

{{DEFAULTSORT:Harper, Mrs.}}

'''Mrs. Sturgeon''' is the wife of John Sturgeon, a professor who was shot in the Pacific College shooting.


Mrs. Sturgeon came to the hospital when her husband, John, was injured falling out a window during the Pacific College shooting. She was worried because John is afraid of hospitals. Meredith asked another woman to sit with Mrs. Sturgeon and gave her frequent updates of her husband's condition.

After her husband's surgery, she was told that they'd had to remove two pieces of his skull, but he was alive. They needed to wait for the swelling in his brain to go down before they could put his skull back into place.



She is married to John Sturgeon, a professor at Pacific College.

'''Nancy Temple''' is a woman who came to the ER with nausea and dizziness who was found to be having a heart attack.


Nancy had been experiencing nausea and dizziness since waking up. When she vomited, her daughter made her come into the hospital. The EKG showed that she was having a heart attack. They started her on nitroglycerin and took her to the cath lab. She later had a ventricular wall rupture, so she was rushed into surgery. She died in surgery.



She is married. Her husband was back in Miami.


Her daughter, Kelly, was on a trip with her when she had her heart attack. Kelly was scared to see her mom being rushed away.


*She was  at the time of her death.

{{Patient Infobox |image = x-.png |name = Nick |status = Deceased |diagnosis = *Osteosarcoma *Intradural mets *Cardiac tumor |doctors = *[[Callie Torres]] *[[Miranda Bailey]] *[[Teddy Altman]] *[[Cristina Yang]] |siblings = Sister |job = '''Former'''
Army Ranger |workplace = '''Former'''
United States Army |first appearance = [[Let the Bad Times Roll]] |last appearance = [[Migration]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Jordan Belfi]] }} '''Nick''' is a childhood friend of [[Arizona Robbins]] who came into the hospital with cancer. As a child, Nick was friends with [[Timothy Robbins|Timothy]] and [[Arizona Robbins]]. When they were ten, Tim officiated a wedding between Arizona and Nick, in which he promised to stop pulling the streamers off her bike. Nick was diagnosed with cancer in his leg. He tried naturopathy to treat it. Six years after his diagnosis, he came to Seattle because he knew that Arizona had just married [[Callie Torres|an orthopedic surgeon]]. He had lied and told her that it had only been six months since his diagnosis. Callie and Bailey took him into surgery. Arizona was observing, but when Callie noticed mets in his vessels, she lied to get Arizona to leave. A PET scan revealed mets all over Nick's body, including a tumor in his heart. Arizona was informed that there was very little they could do. When he woke up from surgery, Arizona yelled at him for not coming to her sooner about the cancer because she's a doctor. In her rant, she informed him that he was dying. ''("[[Let the Bad Times Roll]]")'' Cristina and Teddy looked at Nick's scan and developed a plan to remove his tumor and replace his right ventricle. Nick listened to their plan, but since it wouldn't cure him and he'd have to stay in the hospital while his best friend ignored him, he decided he'd rather go to Belize. Callie tried to talk him into the surgery, but he just told her to tell Arizona he says goodbye. After speaking with Callie, Arizona went to convince Nick to have the surgery. After she assured him that she would be there, he agreed to have the surgery. Cristina and Teddy operated with Arizona and Callie watching from the gallery. They watched while Cristina and Teddy went over their options. However, there was no way they could remove the tumor without killing him, so they were forced to close. When Nick woke up from surgery, Arizona was waiting by his bed. She had to inform him that they hadn't been able to do anything and that he was going to die, so he said he'd be going to Belize. ''("[[Migration]]")'' Nick has a sister. When Arizona found out about Nick's condition, she asked him if he had called his sister. Nick had been friends with Arizona and Timothy Robbins since they were kids. He and Timothy joined the Army Rangers together and he was with Tim through basic training, right up to the end. Nick was in the Army Rangers with [[Timothy Robbins]]. He also later worked with orphan girls in Calcutta, giving them polaroid cameras and teaching them photography. He also did a spread on the locals who carry tourists' equipment up K. *He called Arizona by the names of various cities in the state Arizona. '''Nina Rogerson''' is the daughter of [[Cathy Rogerson]].


Nina came into the hospital with her mother, who had a condition that caused bone to grow at the site of any trauma. She was very protective over her mother and yelled at anybody she felt might possibly hurt her mother. When her mother was told she'd bleed to death if she didn't have a risky surgery, she went through with the surgery because Nina wanted her to. However, her mother then died in surgery. She was then told that her mother wanted her to live her life.



She was very close to her mother until her death. When her mother died, she was devastated. She said she should have brought her mother in sooner, despite being reassured that it wasn't her fault.


*She builds dollhouses.

{{Nurse Infobox |image = xNurseGinger.png |name = Ginger |status = Alive |job = Nurse |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Hospital]] |first appearance = [[If Tomorrow Never Comes]] |last appearance = [[Anybody Have a Map?]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Patricia Bethune]] }} '''Ginger''' is a nurse at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. Ginger was part of the code on Jimmy Harper when he had a clot. She talked Izzie through cracking his chest in order to evacuate the clot, encouraging her to stay calm. ''("[[If Tomorrow Never Comes]]")'' After the train crash, Ginger was working in the ER when [[Yvonne]] collapsed from her internal bleeding. She examined Yvonne and noted that she'd been bleeding internally for hours. ''("[[Into You Like a Train]]")'' Ginger was one of Constance's nurses. She had to inform her that she couldn't have any food because she was scheduled for surgery. ''("[[Owner of a Lonely Heart]]")'' When Pruitt Byrd was in the hospital to have a cardiac tumor removed, Ginger was one of his nurses. [[Estelle Byrd]], Pruitt's wife, yelled at Ginger, saying her husband needed his pills hours ago. ''("[[Let the Angels Commit]]")'' When Burke was in the hospital, Cristina stole his food tray in an attempt to get Burke to cave and talk to her, but he paged Ginger, who took the tray from her and gave it to Burke, before asking him if he wanted her to call security. ''("[[Six Days, Part ]]")'' Ginger informed Izzie that there was no OR available for [[Ray Sutera|Ray's]] surgery. When Izzie said it was for the Chief, Ginger said she'd do what she could. ''("[[Crash Into Me, Part ]]")'' When fellow nurse, [[Frankie Shavelson|Frankie]], was weeks pregnant, she collapsed. Her spleen was twisted, but she refused surgery because she was worried about her baby. Her spleen started to un-twist, but then she had abdominal bleeding, so she was rushed into surgery. In surgery, the bleed was stopped, but then Frankie crashed, so they did an emergency c-section to deliver her son. After that, they tried to resuscitate her but they were unsuccessful. Richard then delivered the news of her death to Ginger and the other nurses. ''("[[Anybody Have a Map?]]")'' She is a nurse at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. Previously, she worked at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. *Ginger has been credited as Older Nurse. *She has Peppermint Patty underpants.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] *She gave [[Debbie]] crocheted booties and a bottle of gin for Christmas.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] NurseGinger.png|[[If Tomorrow Never Comes]] NurseGinger.png|[[Into You Like a Train]] NurseGinger.png|[[Owner of a Lonely Heart]] NurseGinger.png|[[Let the Angels Commit]] NurseGinger.png|[[Six Days, Part ]] NurseGinger.png|[[Crash Into Me, Part ]] xNurseGinger.png|[[Anybody Have a Map?]] {{Nurse Ginger Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[fr:Infirmi\uere Ginger]] [[es:Enfermera Ginger]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Ginger}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Nurses]]

{{Nurse Infobox |image = xNurseRuth.png |name = Nurse Ruth |status = Alive |marital = Husband |children = Child |job = Nurse |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] |first appearance = [[Something's Gotta Give]] |last appearance = [[Could We Start Again, Please?]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Teresa Huang]] }} '''Ruth''' is a nurse at\ua[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. When a foreign Emir was at the hospital after a car accident, Ruth was one of his nurses. ''("[[Something's Gotta Give]]")'' When John Sturgeon's wife, [[Mrs. Sturgeon]], arrived at the hospital after the shooting, Ruth informed the doctors of her arrival. ''("[[Disarm]]")'' When she had concerns about Zola, [[Janet Meyers]] asked Ruth to page Derek several times, saying it was very important. Ruth informed her that as he was a neurosurgeon, everyone paging him thought it was very important. She told Janet she'd let her know when he called back. ''("[[She's Gone]]")'' While [[Dr. Park]] was retrieving a heart for his patient, Ruth told him his hospital was on the line. His patient had died. ''("[[Heart-Shaped Box]]")'' When Meredith and Lexie questioned whether or not they should remove [[Lori Bosson|Lori Bosson's]] tumor, they asked Ruth to check on Derek's progress. She told them he'd almost finished and would be back any minute. ''("[[One Step Too Far]]")'' When one of [[Jeff Russell|Jeff Russell's]] patients started coughing up blood, Ruth went to get Cristina to take care of it. ''("[[Second Opinion]]")'' When a kid came in who had been trampled by a horse, Ruth told Arizona that April asked for some extra help down in the ER. ''("[[I Was Made for Lovin' You]]")'' When Bailey left her wedding to operate on [[Adele Webber]], Ruth informed Owen of that. ''("[[Things We Said Today]]")'' When several nurses threatened to quit over new Pegasus policies, which involved working split shifts, Ruth, after Owen's speech, was willing to give it a try and encouraged others to do the same. ''("[[Hard Bargain]]")'' After the hospital was purchased by several of the doctors, Ruth was trying to get some of the nurses who had quit to come back, but noted that some of them were bitchier than she is. ''("[[Transplant Wasteland]]")'' After Meredith's fall in the stairwell, Ruth went to inform Derek about what had happened, although she confirmed Meredith was doing okay, but on her way to OB to get the baby checked.\ua''("[[Readiness is All]]")'' [[Leah Murphy]] and Ruth entered Jimmy's room, where he was deteriorating. Ruth put on an oxygen mask, while Leah diagnosed him with an MI. She asked for an ECG and a crash cart while Leah paged [[Cristina Yang]]. Later Shane Ross arrived and planned to operate on Jimmy. Leah said that she only paged him to get Yang, who was Jimmy's doctor. Shane said that Yang was at the wedding, and he was there now. Shane said he knew what he was doing, as he'd treated Jimmy before. When Leah protested, Ruth agreed with her and suggested on waiting for an attending when Shane asked Ruth to have an OR cleared for a sternotomy. When Ruth protested, Shane threatened her with having a dead patient on her hands, so she cleared an OR. ''("[[Get Up, Stand Up (Grey's Anatomy)|Get Up, Stand Up]]")'' When [[Donald Mercer]] coded in his hospital room, Jo came in to tend to him, but Ruth said he was already gone. ''("[[Throwing it All Away]]")'' During a virus outbreak, Ruth came to find Derek, who was practicing his speech, saying he was needed to operate even though he wasn't on call because everyone else was sick. She then saw that he was also sick, something he denied. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")'' When Meredith's patient developed a GI bleed, Meredith asked Ruth to get her a second-year resident. Ruth told her all of them were with Derek. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")'' When a heart became available for [[Lincoln McNeil|Link McNeil]], Cristina planned to stay for the surgery, but she was forced to hand it over to Maggie when Ruth came in and told her that the heart was delayed in traffic. ''("[[Fear (of the Unknown)]]")'' When [[Graham Maddox]] was left to finish [[Emily Jensen|Emily Jensen's]] c-section and close, there was torrential bleeding, so he had Ruth go get Arizona from where she was working on Emily's baby. ''("[[Could We Start Again, Please?]]")'' She is married. Her husband works two jobs. ''("[[Hard Bargain]]")'' She has a child. When they were asking the nurses to work split shifts, she was concerned about who would pick up her kid. ''("[[Hard Bargain]]")'' Ruth is a nurse at\ua[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. She has been seen working together with doctors on various specialties. Formerly, she was employed at\ua[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]. *Ruth has been credited as VIP Nurse,\uaNurse, OR Nurse, ER Nurse, and Peds Nurse. xVIPNurse.png|[[Something's Gotta Give]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Disarm]] Nurse.png|[[She's Gone]] ORNurse.png|[[Heart-Shaped Box]] xNurseRuth.png|[[If/Then]] ORNurse.png|[[One Step Too Far]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Second Opinion]] xPedsNurse.png|[[I Was Made for Lovin' You]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Things We Said Today]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Hard Bargain]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Transplant Wasteland]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Readiness is All]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Get Up, Stand Up (Grey's Anatomy)|Get Up, Stand Up]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Throwing it All Away]] xNurseRuth.png|[[You Be Illin']] xNurseRuth.png|[[Go It Alone]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Fear (of the Unknown)]] xNurseRuth.png|[[Could We Start Again, Please?]] x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg {{Nurse Ruth Appearances}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ruth}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Nurses]]

{{Patient Infobox
|image = Paul.png
|name = Paul
|status = Alive
|only appearance = [[It's the End of the World]]
|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Larry Clarke]]
}}

'''Paul''' is the friend of [[James Carlson]] who built the bazooka with him.


Paul and his friend [[James Carlson]] were into World War II history and decided to build a bazooka to re-enact it. They built the bazooka to exact specifications, but when they tried to use it, it didn't fire like it was supposed to. James went to check on it and then it started working and fired a shell into James's chest.

Paul came to the hospital to check on James and was yelled at by [[Mindy Carlson|James's wife]], who hated their hobby. During their argument, Paul revealed that the shell hadn't detonated, meaning there was an active bomb in James's chest.

When the Bomb Squad arrived, Paul helped them by telling him everything he knew about the shell they had built.



He and [[James Carlson]] are best friends. They're both World War II enthusiasts and they often work together to re-enact.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Paul}}

|status = Alive

|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[John Walcutt]]
}}
'''Paul Cotler''' is the husband of [[Linda Cotler]].


Paul came to the hospital with his wife, Linda, who needed her fourth heart surgery in eight years. The doctors planned a more radical approach to remove her malignant myxomas, but he was worried about it. After he was told it was likely her only chance as each surgery made her heart weaker, he asked [[Cristina Yang]] if she would let [[Teddy Altman]] do the surgery on her own husband. When she said she would, he agreed to the surgery.

When he saw Cristina Yang come out to the waiting room during Linda's surgery, he asked about it. When Cristina apologized, he believed Linda had died, but Meredith assured him that she was still alive and they would come tell him when they were done operating. Linda survived her surgery.



He is married to [[Linda Cotler]].

'''Paul Kay'''\uais an [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].


He butted heads with [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] and [[Preston Burke|Burke]] when they stole a patient from their service, a baby with a murmur they had believed to be benign. He had to let them because Burke was an [[Attending|attending]] while he was only a [[Resident|resident]].

{{Attending Infobox |image = x-.jpg |name = Preston Xavier Burke |born = May -June |status= Alive |alias = *Cardio God *Burktini *Mr. Shaky Hands *B |title = M.D., [[Fellow of the American College of Surgeons|F.A.C.S.]] |marital = *[[Cristina Yang]] ''(ex-fianc\uee)'' *[[Edra Burke]] ''(wife)'' |parents = *[[Jane Burke]] *[[Donald Burke]] |children = *Simone Burke *Vivianna Burke |grandparents = Grandmother |other family = *Uncle *Parents-in-law |job = '''Current'''

|first appearance = [[A Hard Day's Night]] |last appearance = [[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Isaiah Washington]]}} {{Quote|I wasn't the most talented student in school. I wasn't the brightest. But I was the best. I practiced.|'''Preston Burke'''}} '''Preston Burke''' is a [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeon]]. He was formerly [[Attending#Department Head|head]] of [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgery]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]], but quit after leaving his fianc\uee, [[Cristina Yang]], during their wedding. After winning a Harper Avery, he founded the [[Klausman Institute for Medical Research]], and ran it until he gave it to Cristina. Preston grew up in Alabama, where his mother owns a restaurant. Before going to his high school prom, he was very nervous because he didn't know how to dance. He asked his uncle, who is good at dancing, to help him. His uncle agreed and taught him a few basic moves. He stayed up nights before the prom practicing his dance moves because he wanted to impress his date. On the night of the prom, it all worked out and he didn't step on his date's feet while dancing and she said that he was a wonderful dancer.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] He completed his pre-medical studies at [[Tulane University]] where he pledged Kappa Alpha Psi and went on to graduate first in his class from [[Johns Hopkins Medical School]]. While in college, he met [[Erica Hahn]], who graduated in second place after him, beginning a rivalry between them. When he was at Mercy West fighting for a heart for Denny, he rushed to the hospital to help Denny right away. Then he got shot in the shoulder before entering the hospital. The wound caused damage to the nerves in his arm and caused him to develop a tremor. He took a long time recovering, but he eventually regained use of his arm and hand and he was able to operate again. Preston was in the mood for a traditional, spirited wedding, which rose conflict with Cristina. In the end, they agreed to have a spirited wedding, but only a small one. The news of the wedding was supposed to be secret, but Mark overheard Preston telling Derek, and soon everyone knew. After the wedding, Burke was nowhere to be found. When Cristina asked Derek about him, he told her Burke had handed in a letter of resignation two weeks ago. Preston Burke was one of the and applicants for the [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery Award]]. He was against many applicants, such as [[Erica Hahn]]. He won following his departure from Seattle Grace. Following his [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery]] win, Preston Burke sought out his next challenge. Connecting with a billionaire investor, Preston founded the [[Klausman Institute for Medical Research]] in Zurich, Switzerland with a focus on cardiac research. As its [[Chief of Staff|chief medical officer]], Preston managed and worked in the institute for some time until he gave it to [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]] in order for him to move to Milan, Italy at the request of his wife.[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]], x He is a brilliant surgeon, however, he is sometimes overbearing, especially when it came to his relationship with [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]]. He is extremely neat and organized, particularly when it comes to [[Burke's Old Apartment|his apartment]], which is spotless. He is an excellent cook and plays the trumpet. [[Cristina Yang]] At the mixer before the interns' first day, Cristina approached Burke but he ignored her and was too interested in his date. He began a relationship with intern [[Cristina Yang]] but broke it off because he feared it would ruin both of their reputations. However, her miscarriage brought them back together. They lived together in his perfectly-kept apartment. However, after being shot he started to have tremors and they were forced to keep them secret putting a strain on their relationship. After a long time of keeping his tremors a secret, Cristina went to the Chief and confessed everything. Initially, he was engaged in a cold war with Cristina, where neither of them spoke but after she broke the silence, he proposed to her and she accepted. However, on the day of their wedding, Burke told Cristina that he no longer wished to make her do anything against her will, and Burke realized he was trying to make Cristina the woman he wanted her to be rather than accepting her as the woman she is. Cristina said she "thought this was what she wanted." He wanted her to say she ''knew'' it was what she wanted, so he left her in the chapel. Cristina then returned to their apartment and discovered Burke had left, taking with him the things that meant something to only him (his trumpet, his Eugene Foote collection, his grandmother's picture, and his lucky scrub cap), leaving Cristina devastated. He told Derek to inform her he quit and sent his mother to collect his things. Years later, despite having moved on and created a family, Burke evidently still had feelings for Cristina, knowing full-well if he were to work with Cristina again, he would inevitably fall for her again to the point of cheating on his wife with Cristina and ultimately "destroy [his] marriage and [his] life". [[Edra Burke]] Burke is currently married to Edra Burke, with whom he has two children: Simone and Vivianna. Edra has sacrificed her career for their family so Burke could run the [[Klausman Institute for Medical Research]], but in , Burke gave his job to Cristina so he and Edra could move to Milan in order to be closer to her parents. [[George O'Malley]] Although Burke initially disliked George, he began to like him and later, George became ''his guy''. George even moved in with him for a while but was kicked out when Cristina walked around naked. Burke was friendly towards Derek for a while but he wasn't ''friends'' with him. He even befriended Addison first. After a bomb scare at the hospital they became good friends. He even chose Derek to be his best man. He was good friends with Richard Webber as well. Dr. Preston Burke used to be the [[Attending#Department Head|head]] [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeon]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] on a salary of $ million. After completing pre-medical studies at [[Tulane University]], Burke graduated first in his class from [[Johns Hopkins Medical School]]. He completed his [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgical]] [[Fellow|fellowship]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. He was once the interim [[Chief of Surgery|chief of surgery]] while Dr. Webber was healing from brain surgery. He was once shot, affecting his control of his right hand. His temporary fix to this possibly long-term problem was to work together with Cristina during every one of his surgeries so that she could take over in case he might have trouble with his hand. The arrangement fell apart after Cristina, reacting to growing stress after George caught onto their secret, went to the Chief and confessed everything. The chief was quite angry at Burke telling him that many patients are at risk and it is a major problem that his hands are not able to function perfectly. The chief referred to Burke's hands as being worth million dollars. Until their secret was revealed, Burke was set to become the next Chief of Surgery, but now he has to compete with his fellow attendings for the position. He recovered full use of his hand after being operated on by [[Derek Shepherd|Dr. Derek Shepherd]]. [[Image:Preston-burke-wins-award.jpg|left|thumb|px|Burke wins a Harper Avery.]] After he left Cristina at the altar, Preston's long-time rival, [[Erica Hahn|Dr. Erica Hahn]], replaced him as the head of cardiothoracic surgery. She has some respect for Burke, but was infuriated when he won a [[Catherine Fox Award|medical award]] instead of her. Following his [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery]] win, Preston, with the help of a billionaire investor, founded the [[Klausman Institute for Medical Research]] in Zurich, Switzerland with a focus on cardiac research. As its [[Chief of Staff|chief medical officer]], Preston managed and worked in the institute for some time until he gave it to [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]] in order for him to move to Milan, Italy at the request of his wife.[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]], x *Cristina rarely called Burke by his first name, Preston. *He learned to cook because his mother owned a restaurant in Alabama. *He plays the trumpet and enjoys jazz music, especially [[Eugene Foote|Eugene Foote's]]. He performed surgery to remove the pacemaker on his musical hero at Foote's request, but against Burke's better judgment. Unfortunately, Foote died during surgery.[[Blues for Sister Someone]], x *Burke was the only cardiothoracic [[Transplant Surgery|transplant specialist]] at Seattle Grace[[ Seconds]], x, a role presumably taken over by [[Erica Hahn|Dr. Hahn]] upon on his departure. *When casting for Burke, he was described as a nebbishy, stout forty-something man. *In the alternate reality episode [[If/Then]], Preston Burke is one of the missing characters, though it is explained that he had a romantic relationship with [[Cristina Yang]] and abruptly left the hospital shortly after. *Burke believes his scrub caps are lucky and he feels nervous about surgery without them. *During season one, despite being a cardiothoracic surgeon, Burke oversaw, and ultimately performed, an appendectomy. Additionally, he was planned to perform a Whipple. Both procedures are typically performed by a general surgeon, however Burke is likely to have been certified in general surgery before completing his cardiothoracic fellowship. *In , Preston Burke was a [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic]] [[Fellow|surgical fellow]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].[[Shake Your Groove Thing]], x *In the season seven episode [[Shock to the System]], a former patient of Burke is hospitalized. Teddy Altman is rather critical of Burke's approach to her treatment, calling it 'conservative' and proposes a radically new procedure. It should be noted though that years had passed since Burke last treated the patient, so Teddy's approach may have been unknown to Burke back then. *He is said to make great paella, a rice dish.[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]] *He loves to watch the rain.[[Six Days, Part ]], x *He had the lowest mortality rate while at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] *Burke does not eat red meat.[[Let It Be]], x *Burke is a Gemini.[[The Becoming]], x PrestonBurke.png PrestonBurke.png PrestonBurke.png xPrestonBurke.png {{GalleryLink}} These episodes are Burke-centric or otherwise very informative about his life. *[[Who's Zoomin' Who?]] *[[Deterioration of the Fight or Flight Response]] *[[Losing My Religion]] *[[I Am a Tree]] *[[Didn't We Almost Have It All?]] *[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]] :'''Preston:''' Cristina, I could promise to hold you and to cherish you. I could promise to be there in sickness and in health. I could say till death do us part, but I won't. Those vows are for optimistic couples, ones full of hope. And I do not stand here on my wedding day optimistic or full of hope. I am not optimistic, I am not hopeful, I am sure, I am steady, and I know that I am a heart man. Taken apart, put back together, I hold them in my hands. I am a heart man. So this I am sure, you are my partner, my lover, my very best friend. My heart, my heart beats for you and on this day, the day of our wedding, I promise you this, I promise you to lay my heart in the palm of your hands. I promise you me.[[Didn't We Almost Have It All?]], x ---- :'''Preston''' '''(to [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]]):''' I am Preston Burke. A widely renowned [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic]] surgeon. I am a professional and more than that I am a good and kind person. I am a person that cleans up behind myself. I am a person that cooks well. And you, you are an unbelievable slob, a slovenly, angry intern. I am Preston Burke and you, you are the most competitive, most guarded, most stubborn, most challenging person I have ever met and I love you. '''Pruitt Byrd''' is a patient with a cardiac tumor who needed a "Humpty-Dumpty" surgery.


Pruitt had been diagnosed with a primary cardiac tumor and was sent to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] to see [[Preston Burke]]. He and his wife were told he needed a cardiac auto-transplantation.

Pruitt was taken into surgery to have the tumor removed and it went very well.



He is married to [[Estelle Byrd]].

{{Attending Infobox |image = xRajSen.png |name = Raj Sen |status = Alive |title = M.D. |job = [[Attending]] [[Psychiatry|Psychiatrist]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Hospital]] |first appearance = [[The First Cut Is the Deepest]] |last appearance = [[Back Where You Belong]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Anjul Nigam]] }} '''Raj Sen''' is a [[Psychiatry|psychiatrist]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. Raj was one of the doctors who saw [[Meredith's Roommate Notice|Meredith's roommate notice]] and tried to move in with her. She declined when their music interests clashed. ''("[[The First Cut Is the Deepest]]")'' Raj brought [[Mr. Duff]] to the surgeons, saying Mr. Duff was his gift to them. He'd had two seizures since being admitted to the psychiatric ward and had to be cleared before he could be returned. ''("[[Save Me]]")'' Raj consulted on [[R. Hubble|Mr. Hubble's]] case after he swallowed Judy doll heads. He suggested that he might idolize the dolls as partners or he planned to derive sexual pleasure from passing them. ''("[[Enough is Enough]]")'' Shane Herman came in with what was believed to be a male hysterical pregnancy. He was then stolen by surgical interns, who believed it was a surgical case. Meredith had to distract Raj while they stole his chart because they hadn't taken it when the took Shane himself. Raj later came to where they had taken Shane and fought with them over whether he was a psych patient or a surgical patient. Surgery ultimately won. ''("[[Something to Talk About]]")'' After the doctors discovered that Bex Singleton was intersex, they consulted with psych and Raj told Bex's parents that most intersex individuals start to identify very strongly with one sex and it's not always the one they've been raised. ''("[[Begin the Begin]]")'' He was called in to consult on Jesse Fannon, who had OCD that caused a car accident. He explained Jesse's condition to Cristina. ''("[[Superstition]]")'' When James Miller came into the clinic claiming that his foot was not part of his body, Raj said he had body dysmorphic disorder and suggested that Bailey prescribe anti-anxiety drugs to lessen the urgency. ''("[[Haunt You Every Day]]")'' When Claire Nolan came into the ER, confused and seeming delusional, Raj examined her and tentatively diagnosed her with schizophrenia. When her parents arrived at the hospital, information her mother gave supported that diagnosis. He said they'd stabilize her with haloperidol and then there were other medications they could try. He also offered support programs to her family to help them. ''("[[Back Where You Belong]]")'' Dr. Raj Sen is a [[Psychiatry|psychiatrist]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. He provides psych consults for the doctors relating to patients with apparent psychiatric issues and sometimes is fodder for conflict with the regulars. He once fought with [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]], [[Izzie Stevens|Izzie]], and [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] over a male patient who declared himself pregnant and another time an elderly woman was thrust upon him by [[George O'Malley|George]]. *His favorite ''s band is ''Twisted Sister''.[[The First Cut Is the Deepest]], x *In his [[The First Cut Is the Deepest|first appearance]], Raj was wearing scrubs normally associated with [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|interns]] and [[Resident|residents]] and carrying x-ray films, but by his second episode, Raj was explicitly stated to be one of the [[Psychiatry|psych interns]] wearing scrubs of that department. It is unclear if this was a show error or if Raj was among one of the surgical interns that would transfer to an "easier specialty" which [[Richard Webber|Richard]] mentioned during the [[A Hard Day's Night|pilot]]. '''Randall Jones''' is the husband of [[Howard Jones]].


Randall's husband, Howard, was in the hospital waiting for a heart transplant. When one became available, Howard and Randall were told he'd be getting the transplant that day. However, when [[Maggie Pierce]] went to retrieve the heart, she found it covered in hematomas, making it unsuitable for transplant. She had an intern tell Howard and Randall that he would be remaining on the list.



He is married to [[Howard Jones]].


*He is very emotional. He cried when he learned his husband would be getting a heart transplant.

'''Ray Jones''' is a florist who crashed his van into the front of the hospital.


Ray, tired after working overtime to make his deliveries, crashed his florist van into the emergency room at the hospital. He sustained several injuries in the crash, including an intrapericardial diaphragmatic hernia, which required surgery.

After surgery, Ray said that he was getting out of the business because he didn't feel the magic of it anymore.


Ray is a florist. After crashing his van falling asleep at the wheel while trying to make all his deliveries, he decided to get out of the business.

'''Ricky''' is a cystic fibrosis patient who had a lung transplant.


Ricky had cystic fibrosis and was in the hospital to have a lung transplant. His girlfriend, [[Julia (Not Responsible)|Julia]], came to the hospital with him when he had his surgery. However, before his surgery, they found out that Julia also had cystic fibrosis, meaning that being around her was extremely dangerous for him. Teddy refused to do the transplant unless they agreed to break up. They did, but Lexie found Julia waiting outside the hospital and convinced Julia that slow, joint suicide was not romantic, prompting her to leave for real. Lexie then had to break the news to Ricky.



Ricky was seeing [[Julia (Not Responsible)|Julia]], who also had cystic fibrosis. Teddy forced them to break up in order to get his lungs. They said they did, but secretly planned to stay together until Lexie talked to Julia and told her there was nothing romantic about joint suicide.

'''River Epley''' is a teen who jumped off a roof while using LSD.


River and his friend, [[Jarah Al-Hasan]], were hanging out at River's house when they decided to take LSD. While experiencing the effects of LSD, they believed a bat was after them. They jumped off the roof, aiming to land in the pool. River did so, but Jarah hit the ground instead. Both teens were transported the hospital, where River was examined and told to wait in his bed. Still under the effects of the LSD, he decided to get up instead and went out to the ambulance bay, where he jumped off an ambulance, landing on [[Jo Wilson]]. He was taken into the ER, where Teddy stapled his forehead while Link examined his leg, which was broken. After a CT, Teddy told him he had a mild concussion, so they'd observe him overnight and he'd have surgery the next day on his leg. He was also told Jarah had a long road ahead, but he'd make it. He and his father then went to Jarah's room to apologize to his father. [[Mr. Al-Hasan]] said they'd get through it together.



His father came to the hospital when was injured.


He and [[Jarah Al-Hasan]] are friends and lab partners.


*He was sixteen at the time of his accident.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Epley, River}}

'''Robbie McCutcheon''' was in the hospital trying to pass a kidney stone when he was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy.



Robbie was in the hospital, trying to pass a large kidney stone. Because of its size, [[Miranda Bailey|Dr. Bailey]] scheduled surgery to remove it. However, he began having runs of VTach, so a cardio consult was called. [[Maggie Pierce|Dr. Pierce]] discovered that he had cardiomyopathy, so he needed cardiac anesthesia for his surgery.


Searching for a cause for the cardiomyopathy, Dr. Pierce had Dr. Bailey map his genome. The map revealed the RAF  mutation, which had been discovered to cause cardiomyopathy only a week before.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*The discovery of his mutation led to diagnoses for [[Francesca McNeil|Frankie]], [[Lincoln McNeil|Link]], and [[Ivy McNeil]].

'''Robert Bonocore''' is a\ua[[Neurosurgery|neurosurgeon]]\uaat the\ua[[Cleveland Clinic]].



Due to his work regarding an epilepsy neurostimulator, Robert received a nomination for the  Harper Avery Award.

At the party before the award ceremony, Robert met\ua[[Cristina Yang]]. After introducing himself,\uahe told her he was a huge fan and that he read all her work on her conduit research. He found it fascinating. They were joined by another doctor who was also fond of Cristina's work. Robert and the doctor kept asking questions to a distracted Cristina. Robert was primarly fascinated that she was nominated for a Harper Avery Award so early in her career, as she was still only a [[Fellow|fellow]]. Their conversation was interrupted by the buzzer that informed them that they could all go to their table in the room where the award would be handed out.

Unfortunately, Robert did not win the Award.



He was a huge fan of\ua[[Cristina Yang]], who was nominated for a Harper Avery in the same year as he was,\uaand was fascinated by her work regarding conduits. He read all about it and he told her about this.


Dr. Robert Bonocore is a neurosurgeon at the Cleveland Clinic. In , he was nominated for an Harper Avery Award for his work with an epilepsy neurostimulator.


*Due to his brain mapping project, Derek referred three patients in one week to the Cleveland Clinic. It's possible they came under the Robert's care.

'''Roy Henley''' was a patient who was treated for end-stage pulmonary hypertension.



Roy came into the hospital with trouble breathing and wheezing. He had pulmonary hypertension. He had been told by a previous doctor that he'd eventually need a lung transplant, but that he was too healthy at the time. After two days in the hospital, he had developed fungal pneumonia and was going into kidney failure. The time had come for him to get a lung transplant. [[April Kepner]] decided to convene a panel to decide whether or not Roy would going on the transplant list for new lungs. [[Cristina Yang]] tipped her off that Teddy had had two days to get him on the transplant list and she hadn't. At the panel, April recommended that Roy not be put on the transplant list. However, Cristina spoke up, saying that all his labs were borderline, but she believed Roy would live because he had the will to make it, which she says is just as important as any medical tests. ''("[[Almost Grown]]")''


When lungs became available for Roy, Teddy sent Cristina to monitor him with [[Dr. McQueen|Dr. McQueen's]] help while she went to retrieve them. His daughter also agreed to come into the hospital. Shortly after she arrived, he developed cor pulmonale because of the stress his bad lungs put on his heart. His daughter was told he might need a new heart as well as his lungs. Cristina did several things in order to keep him stable while they waited for the lungs. They ended up putting him on ECMO and Teddy hoped that the heart damage would reverse once they got the lungs in. They transplanted the lungs and his heart started beating normally. ''("[[That's Me Trying]]")''



He was married. He says his divorce was messy. ''("[[Almost Grown]]")''


He was estranged from his daughter, Corrine. He says that his divorce was messy and Corrine sided with her mother. Corrine said that he tried to be there for her for a while, but he eventually stopped because she couldn't forgive him for leaving her mother.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.

'''Ruth''' is the wife of [[Casey (Things We Lost in the Fire)|Casey]].


When Ruth's husband, [[Casey (Things We Lost in the Fire)|Casey]], was burned while fighting a wildfire, she was called to the hospital. Before she went in to see him, [[Maggie Pierce]] told her she needed to prepare herself because his injuries were so severe. She understood that Casey was going to die. She went into his room and told him she loves him and their kids love him and asked if this was the one. She sat with him while he died of his injuries.



She was married to [[Casey (Things We Lost in the Fire)|Casey]] until his death. Due to his work as a firefighter, they knew that it was likely he would end up dying in the performance of his duties.


She and her husband have two children, Doug and Susan. When Ruth got the call about Casey, she called the kids and said that their father loves them and they told her they love him, too.

'''Ruthie Carlin''' is a patient who came in to have a valve replaced and had trouble deciding which kind of valve to get.


Ruthie was in the hospital for a valve replacement. She originally planned to get a mechanical valve, but when she heard about the clicking noise it made, she reconsidered and thought she might want a porcine valve instead.

After her sister ate a pork chop, she said that she didn't feel kinship with the pig and wondered if the bovine valve might be better. She asked if she could see the valves and make her decision that way. She said neither one was speaking to her, so Cristina said she just had to make a decision. She chose pig.

In surgery, there was unexpected bleeding, but Teddy told Cristina she could handle it and didn't step in to help. Cristina eventually made the decision of what to do. She was able to save Ruthie and finish the surgery.



She has a sister. She also has a cousin whose wife is a cardiologist.


*She's allergic to aspirin, ibuprofen, bananas, zucchini, squash, latex, and dust mites.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Carlin, Ruthie}}

}}
'''Sabine McNeil''' is the mother of [[Ivy McNeil|Ivy]], [[Francesca McNeil|Frankie]], and [[Lincoln McNeil|Link McNeil]], all of whom developed cardiomyopathy.



Ivy, , was diagnosed with dilated cardiomyopathy. She spent four months waiting for a heart transplant before one came through. The transplant was successful and Ivy began to recover. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks post-op, Ivy's indices were good and she was recovering well. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

Later, Ivy spiked a fever. Cristina took her to the OR for a biopsy, which revealed that she was rejecting her donor heart. They treated it with anti-rejection medication and put Ivy back on the transplant list. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

Still in full rejection, Ivy was kept in isolation. While Frankie was in surgery to receive a heart transplant, Ivy declined, bumping up her status to A. When a second heart was found to replace the one that failed for Frankie, it was instead redirected to Ivy. The transplant was successful and she was recovering well. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Ivy was later discharged to recover at home. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


While Ivy was in surgery getting her new heart, [[Jon McNeil]] brought their second child, Frankie, into the ER because she was coughing up pink fluid. She, too, was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy. The doctors inserted a pacemaker. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks after her pacemaker was inserted, Frankie was doing well, even walking around the hospital. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

While playing Hide and Seek with [[Braden Morris]], Frankie collapsed in a hallway. When she was found, her pulse was weak and she wasn't breathing well. She was taken into surgery to insert an LVAD and then she was put on the transplant list. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

Frankie's LVAD failed to reverse the heart damage, which left her in desperate need of a heart. One became available, but when they transplanted it, they discovered that it had been damaged during retrieval and couldn't keep her alive. When a second heart became available, Arizona and Alex went to retrieve it personally while Frankie was kept on bypass in the hospital. While they were gone, Ivy declined rapidly, bumping up her status. Cristina made the decision to redirect the second heart to Ivy, who was more stable and had a better chance of survival, while she attempted a total artificial heart on Frankie. That procedure was unsuccessful and Frankie was pronounced dead in the OR. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

After Frankie's funeral, Sabine snapped at an orderly who tried to take Frankie's pillow. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


While waiting in Frankie\us room while the doctors talked to his parents, Link started to cough up pink fluid just as Frankie had. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Link was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy and declined quickly. They attempted to put him on a Berlin Heart, but he was clotting too much. They put him on ECMO and he stabilized. However, after  days on ECMO, he began clotting even with heparin. Owen was able to convince the FDA to give compassionate release to use a drug-eluting heart pump to buy Link more time to wait for a heart transplant. The device was implanted successfully and they said they'd wait  hours and start to wake him up. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

Link's heart pump worked well, keeping him stable as he waited for a heart transplant. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Link was later discharged and allowed to wait for a heart transplant at home. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''

A heart became available for Link during the aftermath of the explosion at the Mall of the Woods. Despite this, they had Link come in to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] for his transplant. The transplant was successful. ''("[[Fear (of the Unknown)]]")''


A few weeks after Link's heart transplant, [[Maggie Pierce]], who was looking into genetic causes of cardiomyopathy for another patient, discovered what had caused the McNeil kids' cardiomyopathy. A mutation called RAF  had been discovered to cause cardiomyopathy only a week before and all three McNeil children had that mutation. Sabine was relieved that it wasn't something in their house or something she had done. ''("[[Puzzle With a Piece Missing]]")''



[[Jon McNeil]]
Sabine is married to Jon McNeil, with whom she has three children. When the stress of their three kids being in the hospital started to get to them, they fought, Jon walked out, and Sabine wondered if it would destroy their marriage. However, Jon came back, saying that he had fallen asleep in the car and his phone had died. He apologized and they made up.


Sabine has three kids, who have all been diagnosed with cardiomyopathy.


[[Teresa Morris]]
While their kids were hospitalized, Sabine and Teresa bonded over questioning whether or not to trust the doctors to save their children.


[[Cristina Yang]]
Both Sabine and Jon grew to know and trust Cristina Yang while their children were hospitalized. When Cristina disappeared after losing the [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery Award]], they were discontent with having [[Jeff Russell]] do Frankie's heart transplant.

'''Sean Allen''' is the husband of [[Kim Allen]].


Sean's wife, Kim, had terminal lung cancer. Despite his doubts, she decided to end her life with the help of the doctors. When the time came, he had to scramble around to find the money to pay for the medication because insurance wouldn't pay for it. He then lay beside his wife as she died.



He was married to [[Kim Allen]] until her death.

'''Sean Brotherton''' is the husband of [[Teresa Brotherton]] and father of [[Keisha Brotherton]].


Sean came to the hospital after his wife fell down the stairs holding their baby. He was primarily worried about his wife and told the doctors to do whatever they needed with their baby. They'd only just adopted her and Sean didn't feel like he had bonded with her very well. She hadn't even been named yet because they wanted to get to know her first.

When it started to look like his wife wouldn't make it, he wanted to know who to call because he didn't think he could raise the baby on his own. While Teresa was having surgery, Meredith came out to give him an update and said that some people bond instantly and others take a while to feel like a family. He might know his daughter more than he thinks. He listed off all the things he knows about her. Meredith says that's five things he knows that no one else does.

When the doctors informed him that Teresa had died, he decided to keep the baby. He named her Keisha because that's what Teresa wanted to name her.



He was married to [[Teresa Brotherton]] until her death.


He and Teresa adopted a baby girl. They didn't name her right away because they wanted to get to know her first. Teresa bonded with the baby right away, but Sean didn't. He briefly considered giving her back when it looked like his wife was going to die, but after she died, he decided to keep her and name her Keisha because that's what Teresa wanted to name her.


He is a plumber for Plumbing Service and Repair.

'''Shane Herman''' is a man who was admitted to psych because he believed he was pregnant.


While his wife, Tina, was pregnant, Shane jokingly took a pregnancy test. They were both shocked when it came back positive. Then Shane's abdomen started to grow right along with Tina's. Shane was admitted to the hospital's psych ward after he freaked out about being pregnant because they believed it was all in his head, but a few of the surgical interns stole him and began investigating the actual cause of his large abdomen. They could feel a solid mass in his abdomen, indicating that it wasn't a hysterical male pregnancy. After running tests, the doctors diagnosed a mesenteric teratoma, a potentially malignant mass. The case drew extensive attention, with doctors paying money for spots in the room. The attention made the Hermans nervous. Meredith eventually stepped in and forced everyone to leave the room and give the Hermans their privacy. Shane was taken into surgery to remove the mass. After it was removed, Meredith took the mass to dispose of it, as she had promise the Hermans she would so it wouldn't be put on display in a jar.



He is married to [[Tina Herman]].


He and his wife are expecting their first child.

'''Sheryll Jeffries''' is a woman who came into [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] hoping to be part of [[Cristina Yang|Cristina's]] HLHS trial.



Sheryll was diagnosed with hypoplastic left heart syndrome. Surgery to correct it failed, leading her doctors to recommend that she be put on a transplant list.


Sheryll became pregnant after running away, thinking she was going to die. She had dropped out of school and hitchhiked. However, becoming pregnant made her want to live, so she sought out Cristina's trial.


When Sheryll heard about Cristina\us trial, she thought she was an ideal candidate. When Shane informed her that she was too old for the trial, she asked him to bend the rules. He unsuccessfully tried to get Cristina to agree.


While talking to Shane, Sheryll's water broke and she was taken to Labor and Delivery. She continued to try to make her case while laboring, even having Shane bring Cristina in to speak to her personally. Cristina examined her and offered her best wishes, but still declined her request to join the trial.



Parents
Sheryll stated that her parents don't talk to her since she got pregnant. While giving birth, she called out for her mother.


*She was  years old when her daughter was born.
*Her daughter was born  weeks premature.
*She doesn't know who the father of her daughter is.

'''Sonya Cowlman''' came into the hospital after getting caught on her ex-husband's penis piercing while they were having sex.


Sonya and her ex-husband, Adam, were having a secret affair. While they were having sex, her IUD became caught on his new penis piercing and they became stuck together. They used x-ray imaging to see how they were hooked and they manually separated them. Just as they were separated, Adam had a heart attack and his aorta dissected.

Sonya was told afterward to use a back-up birth control method as her IUD had to be removed. She said she doubted she'd be having sex anytime soon because she was going to tell her husband about her affair with Adam.



[[Adam Morris]]
She and Adam Morris were married for  years and had one daughter, Jennifer. They divorced, but five years later, they were still sleeping together when they met up at events. During one encounter, they got stuck together and had to go to the hospital to be separate. Sonya decided that that would be their final encounter and she was going to come clean to her husband. She said that the first time it happened, she felt guilty, but it kept happening and she stopped feeling guilty.

Tom Cowlman
After divorcing Adam, Sonya married Tom. Despite this, she continued to sleep with Adam occasionally. After they were hospitalized for getting stuck together during sex, Sonya decided that she had to tell Tom about Adam.


She has one daughter with her first husband, Adam. According to her, Adam coddles her.


She sells real estate.
