'''Teresa Brotherton''' came into the hospital after falling down the stairs while holding her newborn.


Teresa walked into the ER holding her baby. She was upset because she had fallen down the stairs while holding her and was worried she was seriously injured. She passed her baby over to the doctors. Shortly thereafter, she collapsed. She had no pulse. In the ER, [[Cristina Yang]] relieved a tension pneumothorax and then [[Erica Hahn]] took over and took Teresa for a CT. Teresa has multiple broken ribs and a hemothorax, so she was taken into surgery. She survived the surgery and then made it through the night.

In the morning, Lexie brought the baby in to see them, but Teresa's heart stopped and the baby was sent back while they got her heart started again. Her other lung was leaking, but they couldn't operate because her heart couldn't take the strain.

Knowing she wouldn't make it another day without surgery, they put her on a heart-lung machine in her room so she could be transported to the OR for surgery. They found a hole in her remaining lung and patched it. They were hoping it would hold and that was the only tear. When they checked, they found another leak. They tried to repair the damage, but they were unable to and Teresa died in the OR.



She was married to [[Sean Brotherton]] until her death.


She and Sean adopted a baby girl. They didn't name her right away because they wanted to get to know her first. Teresa bonded with the baby right away, but Sean didn't. He briefly considered giving her back when it looked like his wife was going to die, but after she died, he decided to keep her and name her Keisha because that's what Teresa wanted to name her.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Brotherton, Teresa}}

'''Teresa Morris''' is the mother of [[Braden Morris]], a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Her son, Braden, was diagnosed with SCID after birth. They started searching for a bone marrow donor, but ethnic donors are scarce, so they were never able to find one. However, they were able to treat his condition with enzyme injections. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''


Braden's parents brought him into the GSM ER when he became congested. He was given antibiotics and IVIG to treat the sinusitis. However, he also had a bump on his forehead which he thought was a zit but was actually a Pott's Puffy Tumor. He was taken in to surgery to have it drained. In surgery, the doctors noted cerebral spinal fluid, meaning that the abscess had penetrated his brain, meaning they needed to call in Dr. Shepherd. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''


After surgery, Braden was put into an isolation room because the enzyme injections had stopped working, leaving him vulnerable to infection. He woke up and was scared when he saw where he was. His parents assured him through the plastic barrier that they weren\ut leaving him and they love him. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks post-up, Braden's infection had cleared up. However, his T-cell count was still zero, so he had to remain in isolation. He used a remote control car to break through the plastic and escape to play tag, but he was quickly found and taken back into isolation. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''


[[Miranda Bailey]] had the idea to use deactivated HIV to deliver the enzyme to Braden's body. His parents were initially concerned about the use of HIV, but Dr. Bailey assured them that she was not going to give Braden HIV. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

After receiving chemotherapy to kill off the enzyme-deficient bone marrow, Braden contracted a viral infection, concerning his parents. Worried that the treatment would make Braden even sicker, Teresa withdrew consent for the gene therapy. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Unbeknownst to the Morrises, Bailey proceeded with the gene therapy as planned. It went well and Braden's T-cell count was up to . He beat the infection and was able to start eating solid food again. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


After the treatment, Braden improved enough that Bailey felt comfortable discharging him. However, before she could do that, she had to inform his parents that she had gone ahead with the treatment. When she told them, they began to doubt the results. They also decided the press charges against Bailey for assault and battery. Owen and Jackson were able to assure them that the results were as she said they were, but not to drop the charges.

Stephanie Edwards lied and told them that she had forgotten to tell Bailey that they had withdrawn consent and it was entirely her fault. That still didn't convince them until they held their son and they agreed to drop the charges in exchange for Dr. Edwards being suspended for a week. ''("[[Everything I Try to Do, Nothing Seems to Turn Out Right]]")''


After being discharged, Braden had a follow-up with his pediatrician and he was very healthy. ''("[[Fear (of the Unknown)]]")''



[[David Morris]]
She is married to David Morris, with whom she has one son, [[Braden Morris]].


[[Braden Morris]]
Teresa has a son, Braden, who has SCID. Because of his condition, she is constantly concerned about his health, much to his annoyance.


[[Sabine McNeil]]
While their kids were hospitalized, Teresa bonded with Sabine over the feeling that their kids trust them, but they can't do anything for them, so they have to trust doctors and whether or not trusting the doctors is in their best interests.


*She hates when Braden refers to SCID as "Bubble Boy Disease."<ref>[[You Be Illin']], x</ref>

'''Theo Hunt''' is the son of [[Owen Hunt]] and [[Cristina Yang]].


[[File:xNewbornTheoHunt.png|left|thumb]]
In exchange for Owen agreeing not to take a job in Germany, Cristina agreed to have a child. On the day Theo was born, while she was in labor, she expressed regret for agreeing to have him and said it was a mistake. After he was born, she told Meredith she screwed up, but Meredith shushed her and when her son was brought over, she held him and talked to him.
[[File:xBabyTheoHunt.png|thumb]]
When Theo was a young toddler, he fell on concrete steps at a park and cut his head. Cristina brought him to the hospital, where Jo stitched up his head. At this point, Cristina decided to hand over her trial to [[Shane Ross]].

Theo later attended Bailey's seventh birthday party with his parents. At the time, his parents were expecting a second child.


*April and Jackson have a child who is close to him in age.
*He is most likely named after [[Teddy Altman]], whose full first name is Theodora.

'''Thomas Evans''' is a [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeon]] whom [[Derek Shepherd|Derek]] interviewed to replace [[Teddy Altman]], whom he believed was leaving.


As Chief of Surgery, Derek was looking for a new Head of Cardiothoracic Surgery as he believed Teddy Altman was still looking to leave the hospital as soon as her contract ended. Tom Evans, a brilliant cardiothoracic surgeon, spent a day at the hospital on Derek's request and worked together with Cristina. Cristina was blinded by his brilliance and didn't even notice that Tom didn't even allow her to hold the retractor.

When Teddy pointed this out and said that if Tom was in, she was out, Cristina felt torn between the two surgeons. She was convinced however that she was going to learn more from Teddy than from Tom, and asked Owen to convince Derek to offer the position to Teddy. Owen, however, felt that it was an opportunity for him to have Teddy fired, so he wouldn't have to decide anymore between her and Cristina. He convinced Derek to offer the position to Tom, but Tom rejected the offer.


Tom is a brilliant\ua[[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeon]]\uaat Baylor University Medical Center. He once visited\ua[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]\uawhen he was offered the position of\ua[[Attending#Department Head|Head]]\uaof\ua[[Cardiothoracic Surgery]], but he declined the offer.

'''Tim Nolan''' is the father of [[Claire Nolan]].


When Tim's daughter, Claire, was twenty, she disappeared from her home. Her mother said it looked like she'd been kidnapped. After several years of searching for her, they had a funeral for her.

Twelve years after her disappearance, Claire wandered into the [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] emergency room. She was confused and her words didn't make sense. When she went behind the nurses' station and picked up the phone, Nathan and Andrew tried to remove her, but she collapsed to the floor. She needed a pacemaker. He placed a temporary one and got Maggie to sign off as the second authorization for a permanent one since Claire couldn't consent to the surgery. In the surgery, they removed her old pacemaker with difficulty and placed a new one. The serial number from her old pacemaker helped them identify her and the hospital called her parents.

When her mother arrived, she was shocked to learn that Claire was alive, as they'd spent years thinking she was dead. Claire had a psychiatric evaluation, during which she was tentatively diagnosed with schizophrenia. She became agitated when her parents came into the room to see her. She had to be sedated and Dr. Sen started an increasing dose of haloperidol to stabilize her. He also offered to refer her family to long-term housing and support services to help them and Claire cope with the schizophrenia diagnosis.

Later, her parents came into her room again and after a few moments of confusion, she recognized them and said they could sit with her.



He was married to [[Gwen Nolan]]. They divorced due to the stress of their child, Claire, disappearing.


He and his ex-wife have a daughter, Claire, who disappeared as a teen. They believed she'd been kidnapped and were surprised she was alive when she was found several years later.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Nolan, Tim}}

'''Tina Herman''' is the wife of [[Shane Herman]].


While Tina was pregnant, her husband, Shane, jokingly took a pregnancy test. They were both shocked when it came back positive. Then Shane's abdomen started to grow right along with Tina's. Shane was admitted to the hospital's psych ward after he freaked out about being pregnant because they believed it was all in his head, but a few of the surgical interns stole him and began investigating the actual cause of his large abdomen. They could feel a solid mass in his abdomen, indicating that it wasn't a hysterical male pregnancy. After running tests, the doctors diagnosed a mesenteric teratoma, a potentially malignant mass. The case drew extensive attention, with doctors paying money for spots in the room. The attention made the Hermans nervous. Meredith eventually stepped in and forced everyone to leave the room and give the Hermans their privacy. Shane was taken into surgery to remove the mass. After it was removed, Meredith took the mass to dispose of it, as she had promise the Hermans she would so it wouldn't be put on display in a jar.



She is married to [[Shane Herman]].


She and her husband are expecting their first child.

'''Todd Holmes''' is a man whose heart drifted in his chest after his lung was removed.


Todd came into the ER with trouble breathing. He had had his right lung removed when he was nine and was worried the other one was failing. [[Jackson Avery]] and [[Alex Karev]] couldn't find his heartbeat on examination. When his condition worsened, they did an x-ray and called [[Teddy Altman]], who found his heart down by his kidney, which is why he was having trouble breathing. They planned to use saline implants in his chest to move his heart back where it was supposed to be and hold it in place. The surgery went well and Molly was told he'd be fine.



He is dating [[Molly (Push)|Molly]]. She asked him to move in with her right before he started having trouble breathing, so she thought it was an anxiety attack. She apologized when they found out it wasn't.


His parents got married really young and he says they hated each other by the time he was born, which is why he didn't want to rush into things with Molly.

'''Tom Maynard''' was injured along with many other individuals during a train accident. Tom was impaled on a metal pole along with [[Bonnie Crasnoff]].



Tom Maynard was one of the many victims of a train accident brought to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. Tom and [[Bonnie Crasnoff]] were stuck together due to a metal pole puncturing through both of their torsos. After a thorough examination, doctors at Seattle Grace quickly realized that either Tom or Bonnie would have to be removed from the pole to allow the other person to live. Bonnie's injuries were very bad, including a severed spinal column and shredded aorta, leading doctors to decide that Bonnie needed to be moved off of the pole. When doctors approached Tom and Bonnie of their decision Tom was reluctant because he felt that it was unfair for them to choose his life over hers. Eventually Bonnie was able to convince Tom that it was fine she be moved off because he had a better chance of survival. When Tom and Bonnie arrived in the operating room Bonnie asked Tom if he believed in heaven, Tom comforted her by saying that he did. Once Bonnie and Tom were sedated, Bonnie was removed from the pole and quickly passed away. Tom's surgery was successful and he luckily survived the whole ordeal. Tom was later seen\uain a recovery room where he was accompanied by his thankful and excited wife.



Amanda Maynard
Very little is known about the relationship between Amanda and Tom, besides the fact that they are married. During the time Tom was impaled on the pole he made jokes about what his wife would think if she knew he was so close to another woman. However, he said that he believed he would get a free pass because how serious things were. Sometime after Tom and Bonnie went into the OR, Amanda arrived to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] and was later seen hugging [[Preston Burke]] in her husband's recovery room.


[[Bonnie Crasnoff]]
[[File:Inulikeatrain.jpg|thumb|xpx|Tom and Bonnie arriving to Seattle Grace Hospital.]]
While Tom and Bonnie were stuck to the pole they grew close emotionally due to the severe circumstances. Although their situation was very somber, both Bonnie and Tom lightened the mood by making jokes about breath mints and pores. A few minutes before going under Bonnie asked Tom if he believed in heaven, he comforted her, saying that he did believe in heaven.


*[[Bonnie Crasnoff|Bonnie]] claimed that Tom has very nice pores.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Maynard, Tom}}

'''Tom Waller''' is the son of [[Irving Waller]].


Tom and his wife, Irene, came to the hospital with his father, who needed to have a growth removed from his back. However, once they were out of the room, he confessed that he really wanted a penis implant, which would allow him to have sex with his new girlfriend. They tried to talk him out of it and then tried to force him to move into their home, but they ultimately backed off. Irving's surgery was successful and afterward, his girlfriend came to visit him in the hospital.



He is married to [[Irene Waller]].


He and his wife have a daughter, Janey, who is said to be pretty, but not that bright.

His father lives in a retirement home. He was appalled when he heard that his father wanted a penis pump implanted into his scrotum to allow him to get an erection so he could have sex with his girlfriend.

'''Tony Savitch''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] who was admitted for bypass surgery on his heart.


Tony was admitted to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] for heart surgery. He was nervous about the surgery and not eager about the lifestyle changes he needed to make afterward. George comforted him and his wife by saying it was a very routine procedure and that Tony would be fine. He then promised them he'd be okay.

While drawing pre-op labs, George had to stick Tony multiple times before Burke ultimately took over and drew the blood himself.

Burke took him into surgery, where there were complications that resulted in his death. When Burke heard what George had said, he made George tell the family about Tony's death.



He was married to [[Gloria Savitch]] until his death and they had four daughters.


*His room was decorated with children's drawings, presumably drawn by his daughters.
*He has the distinction of being the first person to die on ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]''.

'''Tracey Mitchell''' came into the ER after having a stroke while having sex.


While having sex with [[Brian]], Tracey had a stroke. She was taken to the ER, where they treated her for her stroke and looked for possible causes. Her condition quickly improved, but the cause was still a mystery. When a scan revealed a clot in her leg, Dr. Pierce looked and found a hole in Tracey's heart. She was taken in to have a procedure to plug the hole and she was expected to make a full recovery.



Tracey hooked up with [[Brian]], whom she met at the gym. After speaking with [[Maggie Pierce|Drs. Pierce]] and [[Amelia Shepherd|Shepherd]], he left before she woke up.


Her parents flew in from Arizona when they heard about her stroke.

'''Tyler Moser''' was a patient with cervical spondylosis who had surgery on his neck to repair the damage caused by a car accident.



Tyler, who already had cervical spondylosis, was in a car accident, which further injured his neck. He had four spinal fusions to try to relieve his symptoms, but they were only temporary solutions.


In order to find a solution that would be permanent, Callie came up with a three-day, three-part surgery which would relieve Tyler's symptoms. The plan was for them to remove the old hardware, then take down the scar tissue, and then implant the new cage. After his first surgery, his nerve function was tested every  minutes to make sure there was no nerve damage.

He was taken back in the next day for his second surgery. However, Callie was forced to close early and reframe her plan. She was able to find an alternate way to operate and despite some complications in his third surgery, the procedure was successful.



After his final surgery, Tyler told his parents that he was grateful that they had dropped everything to take care of him after his car accident, but he told them to get a divorce because it was clear that they hated each other.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Moser, Tyler}}

'''Veronica''' is the wife of [[Louie]].


Veronica had an argument with her husband, so he left to blow off some steam. He realized after he slammed the door that the storm was serious, but he didn't want to lose the momentum of the slam, so he went for a walk. During his walk, the wind storm picked up, stirring up a large candy cane, which impaled him through his chest. He was taken to the hospital, where they diagnosed a pneumothorax, but no other obvious injuries. He was taken to surgery, where they cut the top off the candy cane and pulled it through. They were prepared for extensive bleeding and were shocked when they saw the candy cane had not caused any damage to his internal organs aside from a small hole in his diaphragm. His was was told he'd need to rest for a few weeks, but would be okay.



She is married to [[Louie]].


*She writes letters to the neighborhood association every year about Christmas decorations.

'''Vincenzo DeLuca''' is the father of [[Andrew DeLuca|Andrew]] and [[Carina DeLuca]].



At his wedding, his sister or sister-in-law, Stella, had a heart attack. Later, at a cousin's wedding, his wife stabbed him in his hand. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''


In a manic state, Vincenzo operated on seven patients in a row with no sleep or food. Four people died because of him and he got away with it because of his connections. ''("[[Shelter from the Storm]]")''


When he had some troubles, his daughter, Carina came back to Italy to help him sort things out. ''("[[Momma Knows Best]]")'' When she eventually returned to the US, she brought him with her, surprising his son, Andrew. ''("[[We Didn't Start the Fire]]")''


Upon his arrival in the United States, he insisted on going to the hospital where his children work to present his research in the hopes of getting funding. He revealed that he'd developed an external gestational sac for babies who would otherwise die from being born prematurely. He was already using it on sheep successfully. Carina talked to Alex and explained her father's unsteady mental health, but Alex decided to fund the project anyway. After getting his funding, he invited Andrew to join him in his research, believing it would put him on more equal footing with Meredith. ''("[[Blood and Water]]")''

Vincenzo's research continued until a lamb died. He felt it was a natural result of the research and nothing of concern, and scoffed at the suggestion that he was moving too quickly in his research. When he learned that [[Elizabeth Hall]] might lose her baby because she needed a hysterectomy, he went to the Halls directly and said they could use his gestational sac. They wanted to, but they were quickly told that it wasn't available. Instead, Lizzie's baby was delivered and her uterus removed. Vincenzo still believed his way would have worked. However, it made his son realize that he was reckless. Alex then cut off his research funding, so Vincenzo arranged to have the remaining lamb sent back to Italy. ''("[[And Dream of Sheep]]")''


When Andrew died, Carina called him to tell him the news. He said he had already known about his son's death for two days, but didn't reach out to Carina. ''("[[Learning to Fly]]")''



He had a wife, [[Lucia DeLuca|Lucia]], with whom he had Andrew and Carina. They divorced and she moved to the United States. He described her as controlling and blames her for creating a rift between him and his son.


Vincenzo raised his daughter Carina in Italy while his ex-wife moved to the United States with their son, Andrew.


Vincenzo is a surgeon. He started carrying out research on external gestational sacs at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] but it was terminated when his reckless behavior made Alex decide to cut off funding. Vincenzo then set out to continue his research back in Italy.


*His daughter believes he has bipolar disorder, but he refuses treatment.<ref>[[Blood and Water]], x</ref>
*His specialty has not been confirmed other than the exclusion of OB/GYN.
*He is obsessed with 's girls groups.<ref>[[Forever and Ever, Amen]], x (S)</ref>

'''Vinicius Velo''' is a soldier participating in Owen's study on pulmonary fibrosis in veterans.


Vinicius was at the hospital getting tests done to participate in Owen's study on pulmonary fibrosis in veterans when an explosion shook the hospital. Vinicius and the others immediately sought cover and began wondering where the explosion came from. When they recovered from the initial shock, Owen ordered Vinicius and [[Amy Sacilotto]] to help set up a triage area outside the hospital to prepare for the incoming wounded. At the end of the day, Owen thanked them for their help.


He is a private in the U.S. Army.

'''Will Noonan''' is the husband of [[Katy Noonan]], who had heart surgery at [[Mayo Clinic]].



Will and his wife Katy are doomsday preppers, but they're prepping for things like Ozone depletion. They have a seed bank and several "bug-out" bags.


Scans revealed that Katy had a very large aneurysm that had formed because of a congenital heart defect. Two surgeries were planned: the first to fix the aneurysm and the second to repair the defect so another aneurysm wouldn't form.

In her first surgery, her aneurysm burst, but they were able to save her and repair the problem. After surgery, they had to wait until she woke up to see if she'd have lasting damage.

She woke up the next morning and they planned to proceed with the second surgery. When Will vocalized some concerns about the second surgery, Katy reminded them that they take action.

In surgery, Dr. Thomas had a heart attack and died. Despite this, Cristina was able to complete the surgery successfully.



He is married to [[Katy Noonan]]. They met in a workshop on making "bug-out" bags.

Despite Henry warning Teddy that William wasn't a good guy, she went out with him at the end of the day anyway.



He went on a date with [[Teddy Altman]]. He patiently waited even when their date was pushed twice.


Until recently, he lived above his mother's house.
